FuncDef: The undo mac-address all command is used to delete the configured MAC address entries.
CLIs: undo mac-address { { static [ <interface-type> <interface-number> | mac-address ] } | { blackhole [ mac-address ] } | mac-address }

ParaDef.Info:
Displays an entry with a specified MAC address.
The value is a 12-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of H-H-H. Each H is 4 digits. If an H contains fewer than 4 digits, the left-most digits are padded with zeros. For example, e0 is displayed as 00e0. The MAC address cannot be set to FFFF-FFFF-FFFF or a multicast MAC address starting with 01.

Number of blackhole MAC address entries.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
This command is used to delete a manually configured MAC address entry.
